Literature Review: RNA modification plays a crucial role in the development and function of the immune system. Recent studies have highlighted the dynamic nature of RNA modifications, which are essential for various immune processes. In this review, we will discuss the current understanding of RNA modifications in the immune system, their distribution features, and molecular functions. We will also explore the value of innovative RNA modification profiling technologies to uncover the function of these diverse, dynamic RNA modifications in various immune cells within healthy and diseased contexts. Furthermore, we will discuss the mechanisms whereby aberrant RNA modifications modulate the immune milieu of the tumor microenvironment and highlight outstanding research questions.
